segments.text: This kitchen tells a story of routine, interrupted by chaos amidst the everyday.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman focusing on her chores, completely unaware of the water flooding the cabinet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels almost comical how absorbed she is, yet my heart sinks for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool, though, that’s the real danger in this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He reaches for the cookie jar, and I hold my breath, hoping the stool doesn’t tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s hand is stretched toward him, her anticipation clear as day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every second feels stretched, as if time is holding its breath alongside me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but think of all the mess that could ensue if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t they just wait for her to notice them?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This moment encapsulates everything about childhood mischief and adult oblivion.
segments.speaker: PAR
